page.title: 16CORNER FARM, BICTON HEATH.
page.content: Corner Farm is part of the Onslow Estate. A tenant farmer and his son work there. They have a herd of 85 friesian cows for milking. In Autumn they sow wheat and barley and in Spring they spray these crops with fertilisers and insecticides. In 1986 the new Shrewsbury By-Pass will go through Corner Farm so the farmer wants a bridge built over it so that he can take his cows and his tractors to all his fields. Corner Farm used to have 210 acres of land but they had to sell 10 acres for part of a big housing estate called Gains Park. A preservation order has been put on a pool on this estate because a number of great crested newts have been discovered there. This newt is becoming an endangered species.
